knowledge.heading: Insular Perception
knowledge.description: First-person unreliable narration creates a subjective lens that filters all information through a damaged psyche, using dramatic irony to reveal the gap between Merricat's perception and reality.
knowledge.reader_effect: The reader experiences both intimacy with and alienation from the narrator, simultaneously drawn into her worldview while recognizing its distortions and omissions.

quick_reference.voice: First person narration from Merricat's perspective throughout
quick_reference.tone: Darkly whimsical with undercurrents of menace and childlike wonder
